unnormalised: **Automotive News: Fuel Efficiency Focus Drives Innovation**
normalised: Automotive News: Fuel Efficiency Focus Drives Innovation

unnormalised: New Delhi, October 26th - As fuel prices continue to climb, averaging around Rs. 105 per liter in Mumbai, Indian automotive manufacturers are prioritizing fuel efficiency in new vehicle designs. Dr. Anjali Sharma, Head of Automotive Engineering at IIT Madras, highlights advancements in engine technology, including improved combustion and lightweight materials, contributing to enhanced mileage.
normalised: New Delhi, October twenty sixth - As fuel prices continue to climb, averaging around rupees one hundred and five per liter in Mumbai, Indian automotive manufacturers are prioritizing fuel efficiency in new vehicle designs. Doctor Anjali Sharma, Head of Automotive Engineering at I I T Madras, highlights advancements in engine technology, including improved combustion and lightweight materials, contributing to enhanced mileage.

unnormalised: Maruti Suzuki, Tata Motors, and Mahindra are showcasing models boasting increased kilometers per liter (kmpl) at the upcoming Auto Expo in Pragati Maidan. Analysts predict a surge in demand for vehicles exceeding 25 kmpl, especially in urban areas like Bangalore and Chennai, where traffic congestion significantly impacts fuel consumption. The Government of India's push for electric vehicles (EVs) also plays a role, incentivizing hybrid and EV adoption. Consumers are increasingly aware of the long-term cost benefits, despite higher initial investments. Efficient car design, even optimizing features like tire pressure and reducing vehicle weight by a few kilograms, can contribute substantially to fuel savings. Homes with covered parking areas are increasingly common in new housing societies, offering additional sq ft that can affect fuel consumption.
